english_title: Dialects and Readings of the Qur'an (Kitab Al-Huruf Wa Al-Qira'at)

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3969
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) read the Qur'anic verse, "And take ye the Station of Abraham as a place of prayer.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3970
hadith_list.english_text: A man got up (for prayer) at night, he read the Qur'an and raised his voice in reading. When the morning came, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: May Allah have mercy on so-and-so! Last night he reminded me a number of verses which I was about to forget.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3971
hadith_list.english_text:
The verse "And no Prophet could (ever) be false to his trust" was revealed about a red velvet. When it was found missing on the day of Badr, some people said; Perhaps the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) has taken it. So Allah, the Exalted, sent down "And no prophet could (ever) be false to his trust" to the end of the verse.




Abu Dawud said: In the word yaghulla the letter ya has a short vowel a.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3972
hadith_list.narrator: Anas b. Malik reported that Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) as saying:
hadith_list.english_text: O Allah, I seek refuge in Thee from niggardliness and old age.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3973
hadith_list.english_text: I came in the deputation of Banu al-Muntafiq to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). He then narrated the rest of the tradition. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: la tahsibanna (do not think) and did not say: la tahsabanna (do not think).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3974
hadith_list.english_text: The Muslims met a man with some sheep of his. He said: Peace be upon you. But they killed him and took those few sheep. Thereupon the following Qur'anic verse was revealed: "...And say to anyone who offers you a salutation: Thou art none of believer, coveting the perishable good of this life." meaning these few sheep.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3975
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to read: "Not equal are those believers who sit (at home) and receive no hurt (ghayru ulid-darari) but the narrator Sa'id did not say the words "used to read"

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3976
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) read the verse: "eye for eye" (al-'aynu bil-'ayn).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3977
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) read the verse: "We ordained therein for them: Life for life and eye for eye (an-nafsa bin-nafsi wal-'aynu bil-'ayn).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3978
hadith_list.english_text: Atiyyah ibn Sa'd al-Awfi said: I recited to Abdullah ibn Umar the verse: "It is Allah Who created you in a state of (helplessness) weakness (min da'f)."  He said: (Read) min du'f. I recited it to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) as you recited it to me, and he gripped me as I gripped you.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3979
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) read the verse mentioned above, "min du'f."

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3980
hadith_list.english_text: "Say, in the bounty of Allah, and in His mercy- in that let you rejoice."

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3981
hadith_list.english_text: Ubayy ibn Ka'b) said: The Prophet (ﷺ) read the verse: "Say: In the bounty of Allah and in His mercy--in that let you rejoice: that is better than the wealth you hoard."

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3982
hadith_list.english_text: She heard the Prophet (ﷺ) read the verse: "He acted unrighteously." (innahu 'amila ghayra salih).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3983
hadith_list.english_text:
Shahr ibn Hawshab said: I asked Umm Salamah: How did the Messenger of Allah  (ﷺ) read this verse: "For his conduct is unrighteous (innahu 'amalun  ghayru salih". She replied: He read it: "He acted unrighteously" (innahu 'amila ghayra salih).


Abu Dawud said: This tradition has been transmitted by Harun al-Nahwi and Musa b. Khalaf from Thabit as reported by the narrator 'Abd al-Aziz.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3984
hadith_list.english_text:
:






When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prayed, he began with himself and said: May the mercy of Allah be upon us and upon Moses. If he had patience, he would have seen marvels from his Companion. But he said: "(Moses) said: If ever I ask thee about anything after this, keep me not in they company: then wouldst thou have received (full) excuse from my side". Hamzah lengthened it.
hadith_list.grade: صحيح ق دون قوله ولكنه   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3985
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) read the Qur'anic verse: "Thou hast received (full) excuse from me (min ladunni)" and put tashdid (doubling of consonants) on nun (n).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3986
hadith_list.english_text: Ubayy ibn Ka'b made me read the following verse as the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) made him read: "in a spring of murky water" (fi 'aynin hami'atin) with short vowel a after h.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3987
hadith_list.english_text:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: A man from the Illiyyun will look downwards at the people of Paradise and Paradise will be glittering as if it were a brilliant star. 





He (the narrator) said: In this way the word durri (brilliant) occurs in this tradition, i.e. the letter dal (d) has short vowel u and it has no hamzah ('). AbuBakr and Umar will be of them and will have some additional blessings.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3988
hadith_list.english_text:
I came to the Prophet (ﷺ). He then narrated the rest of the tradition. 





A man from the people said: "Messenger of Allah! tell us about Saba'; what is it: land or woman? He replied: It is neither land nor woman; it is a man to whom ten children of the Arabs were born: six of them lived in the Yemen and four lived in Syria. 





The narrator Uthman said al-Ghatafani instead of al-Ghutayfi. He said: It has been transmitted to us by al-Hasan ibn al-Hakam an-Nakha'i.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3989
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) as saying - the narrator Isma'il transmitted it from Abu Hurairah, and mentioned the tradition about the coming down of revelation-: "So far (is this the case) that when terror is removed from their hearts."

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3990
hadith_list.narrator: Narrated Umm Salamah, wife of the Prophet (ﷺ):
hadith_list.english_text:
The reading of the following verse by the Prophet (ﷺ) goes: "Nay, but there came to thee (ja'atki) my signs, and thou didst reject them (fakadhdhabti biha) ; thou wast haughty (wastakbarti) and became one of those who reject Faith (wa kunti).


Abu Dawud said: This is a mursal tradition, i.e. the link of the Companion has been omitted, for the narrator al-Rabi' did not meet Umm Salamah.
hadith_list.grade: Da'if in chain (Al-Albani)  ضعيف الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3991
hadith_list.english_text: I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) read: "(There is for him) Rest and satisfaction" (faruhun wa rayhan).
hadith_list.grade: Sahih in chain (Al-Albani)  صحيح الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3992
hadith_list.narrator: Safwan b. Ya'la quoting his father said:
hadith_list.english_text:
I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) read on the pulpit the verse: "They will cry: O Malik."


Abu Dawud said: That is, without shortening the name (Malik).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3993
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) made me read the verse "It is I who give (all) sustenance, Lord of power, steadfast (for ever).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3994
hadith_list.english_text:
The Prophet (ﷺ) used to read the verse "Is there any that will receive admonition (muddakir)? " that is with doubling of consonant [(dal)(d)].


Abu Dawud said: The word muddakir may be pronounced as mim (m) with a short vowel u. (dal)(d) with a short vowel and kaf (k) with a short vowel i.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3995
hadith_list.english_text: I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) reading the verse; "does he think that his wealth would make him last for ever?"
hadith_list.grade: Da'if in chain (Al-Albani)  ضعيف الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3996
hadith_list.english_text:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) made a man read the verse: "For, that day His chastisement will be such as none (else) can be chastised. And his bonds will be such as none (other) can be bound.


Abu Dawud said: According to some (scholars), there is a narrator between the narrator Khalid and Abu Qilabah.
hadith_list.grade: Da'if in chain (Al-Albani)  ضعيف الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3997
hadith_list.english_text:
A man whom the Prophet (ﷺ) made the following verse read informed me, or he was informed by a man whom a man made the following verse read through a man whom the Prophet (ﷺ) made the following verse read: "For, that day His chastisement will be such as none (else) can be inflicted (la yu'adhdhabu)

 
Abu Dawud said: 'Asim, al-A'mash, Talhah b. Musarrif, Abu Ja'far Yazid b. al-Qa'qa', Shaibah b. Nassah, Nafi' b. 'Abd al-Rahman, 'Abd Allah b. Kathir al-Dari, Abu 'Amr b. al-'Ala', Hamzat al-Zayyat, 'Abd al-Rahman al-A'raj, Qatadah, al-Hasan al-Basri, Mujahid, Hamid al=A'raj, Abd Allah b. 'Abbas and 'Abd al-Rahman b. Abi Bakr recited: "For,that day His chastisement will be such as none (else) can inflict (la ya'adhdhibu), and His bonds will be such as none (other) can bind (wa la yathiqu), except the verse mentioned in this tradition from the Prophet (ﷺ). It has een read yu'adhdhabu with short vowel a in passive voice.
hadith_list.grade: Da'if in chain (Al-Albani)  ضعيف الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3998
hadith_list.english_text:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) related a tradition in which he mentioned the words "Jibril and Mikal" and he pronounced them "Jibra'ila wa Mika'ila."




Abu Dawud said: Khalaf said: I did not put the pen aside from writing letters (huruf) for forty years: nothing tired me (or made me incapable of writing), even Jibril and Mika'il did not tire me.
hadith_list.grade: Da'if in chain (Al-Albani)  ضعيف الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 3999
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) mentioned the name of the one who will sound the trumpet (sahib as-sur) and said: On his right will be Jibra'il and on his left will be Mika'il.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4000
hadith_list.english_text:
The Prophet (ﷺ), AbuBakr, Umar and Uthman used to read "maliki yawmid-din (master of the Day of Judgment)". The first to read maliki yawmid-din was Marwan.



Abu Dawud said: This is sounder that the tradition which transmitted by al-Zuhri from Anas, and al-Zuhri from Salim, from his father (Ibn 'Umar).
hadith_list.grade: Da'if in chain (Al-Albani)  ضعيف الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4001
hadith_list.english_text:
The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) used to recite: "In the name of Allah, the Cherisher and Sustainer of the worlds; most Gracious, most Merciful; Master of the Day of Judgment," breaking its recitation into verses, one after another.



Abu Dawud said: I heard Ahmad (b. Hanbal) say: The early reading is: Maliki yawmi'l-din.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4002
hadith_list.english_text: I was sitting behind the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) who was riding a donkey while the sun was setting. He asked: Do you know where this sets ? I replied: Allah and his Apostle know best. He said: It sets in a spring of warm water (Hamiyah).
hadith_list.grade: Sahih in chain (Al-Albani)  صحيح الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4003
hadith_list.english_text: The Prophet (ﷺ) came to them in the swelling place of immigrants and a man asked him: Which is the greatest verse of the Qur'an ? The Prophet (ﷺ) replied: Allah, there is no god but He - the Living, the Self-Subsisting Eternal. No slumber can seize Him nor sleep."

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4004
hadith_list.english_text: Ibn Mas'ud said read the verse: "Now come, thou" (haita laka). Then Shariq said: We read it, "hi'tu laka" (I am prepared for thee). Ibn Mas'ud said: I read it as I have been taught ; it is dearer to me.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4005
hadith_list.english_text: 'Abd Allah (b. Mas'ud) was told that the people had read this verse: "She said: Now come, thou" (hita laka). He said: I read it as I have been taught ; it is dearer to me. It goes "wa qalat haita laka" (She said: Now come thou).

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4006
hadith_list.english_text: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Allah, the Exalted, said to the children of Israel : "... but enter the gate with humility, in posture and in words, and you will be forgiven your faults (tughfar lakum)".

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4007
hadith_list.english_text: The tradition mentioned above has also been transmitted by Hisham b. Sa'd with a different chain of narrators in a similar way.

hadith_list.title: Sunan Abi Dawud 4008
hadith_list.english_text:
The revelation came down to Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) and he recited to is: "A surah which We have sent down and which We have ordained (faradnaha)"


Abu Dawud said: The letter ra (r) is the word faradnaha has short vowel a (with out doubling of consonant r), and then he reached the verses after this verse.
hadith_list.grade: Sahih in chain (Al-Albani)  صحيح الإسناد   (الألباني) حكم
